You are given a directed acyclic graph with $n$ vertices, numbered from 0 to $n-1$.  Each edge connects vertex $i$ to vertex $(i+1) \mod n$. The direction of each edge can be either from $i$ to $(i+1) \mod n$ or from $(i+1) \mod n$ to $i$.

Two vertices $u$ and $v$ are comparable if there is a path from $u$ to $v$ or from $v$ to $u$ in the graph.

An antichain is a set of vertices where no two vertices are comparable. The size of an antichain is the number of vertices in the set. A maximum antichain is an antichain that is not a subset of any larger antichain.

Your task is to find the size of the maximum antichain in the graph.

**Input:**

The first line contains a string of 0s and 1s of length $n$, where each character represents the direction of an edge. A 0 indicates the edge goes from vertex $i$ to vertex $(i+1) \mod n$, and a 1 indicates the edge goes from vertex $(i+1) \mod n$ to vertex $i$.

**Output:**

Print a single integer representing the size of the maximum antichain.
You are given a directed graph.  Find the largest group of nodes where no two nodes have a path between them.
